div.head: Boundary markers of the fields of the Bendiparoi

p.seg: Three Greek markers found near Philippopolis (mod. Plovdiv in Bulgaria) attest to a single boundary dispute involving the agricultural land (ἀγροί) of an otherwise unattested people or group called the Bendiparoi. The boundary markers were placed by the provincial governor through the agency of another individual “in accordance with the divine verdict” (κατὰ θείαν ἀπόφασιν, i.e., a decision of an emperor).

div.p: According to the divine verdict, boundary markers of the fields of the Bendiparoi placed by Kointos Atrios Clonios, propraetorian legate of the two emperors, through Moukios Oueros.
